comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do not edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: count
description: Returns the total number (count) of input values.

params.name: field
params.description: Expression that outputs values to be counted. If omitted, equivalent to `COUNT(*)` (the number of rows).

examples:
FROM employees
| STATS count = COUNT(*) BY languages
| SORT languages DESC

ROW n=1
| WHERE n < 0
| STATS COUNT(n)

FROM employees
| STATS
    gte20 = COUNT(*) WHERE height >= 2,
    lte18 = COUNT(*) WHERE height <= 1.8

ROW mv = [1, 2], n = NULL, t = TRUE, f = FALSE
| STATS COUNT(mv), COUNT(n), COUNT(t), COUNT(f)

ROW n=1
| STATS COUNT(n > 0 OR NULL), COUNT(n < 0 OR NULL)
